author: @wmbfnews
title: Police: 1 hurt, another in custody after Myrtle Beach assault
text:
Police: 1 hurt, another in custody after Myrtle Beach assault
Published: Apr. 9, 2025 at 5:39 PM EDT|Updated: seconds ago
MYRTLE BEACH, S.C. (WMBF) - Police said one person was hurt and another is in custody after an assault in Myrtle Beach on Wednesday.
The Myrtle Beach Police Department said it was called to Grey Street at around 4:15 p.m. after a reported assault. However, officers later learned that the incident did not happen there.
No further details about what happened were immediately available.
The MBPD said the person injured was taken to a hospital for their injuries.
Anyone with information is asked to call the MBPD at 843-918-1382.
Stay with WMBF News for updates.

Fuera de serie: La femenil se crece y hace historia Nuestra [SelecciÃ³n Femenina de Futbol](https://www.record.com.mx/futbol/futbol-nacional/seleccion-mexicana) dio una gran muestra de talento y determinaciÃ³n en la Copa Oro de la Concacaf. Le [ganÃ³ a Estados Unidos](https://www.record.com.mx/futbol-noticias-futbol-nacional-seleccion-mexicana/dos-a-cero-mexico-vence-a-estados-unidos-y-avanza) con gran personalidad rompiendo un rÃ©cord de 80 partidos que las norteamericanas tenÃ­an sin perder en casa. Acabaron con el dominio de la que es considerada la mÃ¡xima potencia de la Concacaf. TenÃ­amos 14 aÃ±os sin derrotarlas. Defendieron, pelearon cada balÃ³n y mantuvieron un nivel fÃ­sico de primera. Un equipo comprometido a tope. Dos grandes goles, El primero de la â€œMagaâ€ Ovalle y el segundo de Mayra Pelayo quien declarÃ³: â€œNo nos podÃ­amos achicar, salimos a presionarâ€. Con toda la probabilidad y la estadÃ­stica en contra, el equipo se plantÃ³ con lo mejor que tenÃ­a, con seguridad, atrevimiento, determinaciÃ³n y coraje. Este partido nuevamente enfatiza de lo que somos capaces y debemos resaltar la forma en que se consiguiÃ³. Son un gran orgullo, tiene un gran mÃ©rito por todo lo que demostraron con garra y hambre (como declarÃ³ Ovalle). Falta mucho aÃºn, pero hoy toca celebrar y reconocerlas. Un Ã©xito asÃ­ no es una casualidad, resalto algunas variables involucradas en el Ã©xito: 1. Se tiene que creer que se puede ganar para que el equipo se pare como lo hizo. Se requiere una mente preparada, afirmada, determinada. 2. Se necesita la fortaleza fÃ­sica que se demostrÃ³ hasta el final del partido. Eso se trabaja en el esfuerzo de los entrenamientos. 3. Se requiere un planteamiento tÃ¡ctico para jugarle al rival. Implica un conocimiento de cada miembro del equipo para sacar lo mejor de cada jugadora en el partido y colocarla donde sus fortalezcas se muestren mejor. Por todo lo anterior es que el trabajo da fruto y da tanto gusto ver este resultado histÃ³rico. Manifestemos nuestro apoyo para el sector femenil que estÃ¡ cada vez mÃ¡s fuerte. Sigamos impulsando a estas grandes jugadoras difundiendo el Ã©xito en este proyecto que lleva ya 10 aÃ±os de esfuerzo. Son varios los clubes los que han invertido en su desarrollo y el proyecto que ha crecido a la luz de la Liga Femenil Mexicana. El prÃ³ximo domingo se enfrentarÃ¡n a Paraguay en cuartos de final, les deseamos desde esta columna que logren conjuntar todas sus virtudes en la cancha para que obtengan un gran resultado. Estimados lectores y lectoras, difundamos este logro y hablÃ©moslo en nuestros equipos y familias. Celebremos el trabajo de la preparaciÃ³n fÃ­sico, mental y deportivo y aprovechemos este momento para hacernos ver que cuando hay un trabajo bien hecho y una actitud correcta las cosas pueden lograrse. Celebro a estas mujeres mexicanas que hoy son un ejemplo a seguir para todos. â€œRevitalÃ­zate, vuelve a la esencia de lo que te da el Ã©xitoâ€. author: jenniferursillo
title: Drunk NJ priest leads cops on a pursuit after shoplifting heist
text: Drunk NJ priest led high-speed chase after Walmart heist, cops say ðŸ’’ A priest was caught shoplifting from a Walmart in Pohatcong, officials said ðŸ’’ Police also say the Catholic priest was drunk ðŸ’’ He is stepping down as pastor of his church POHATCONG â€” A 39-year-old Roman Catholic priest was arrested for shoplifting from a Walmart Supercenter in the Warren County Township, and then driving away drunk during a police pursuit, officials said. Alpha police said Father Dawid Wejnerowski is accused of stealing less than $50 worth of ice cream containers and oven mitts from the Route 22 store around 10:15 p.m. on Thursday, according to a report on [lehighvalleylive.com](https://www.lehighvalleylive.com/phillipsburg/2024/02/alpha-priest-accused-of-shoplifting-drove-drunk-erratically-to-avoid-arrest-police-say.html). But the trouble didnâ€™t stop there. After the store heist, Wejnerowski then led police officers on a chase through the Parkside neighborhood in the township while drunk, police said. The vehicle wound up on the front yard of a home on Liberty Boulevard. Wejernowski was arrested and charged with disorderly persons shoplifting, second-degree eluding police, drunken driving, having an open container of alcohol in the car, and multiple traffic offenses, according to a statement from the Pohatcong Township police, and reported by [lehighvalleylive.com](https://www.lehighvalleylive.com/phillipsburg/2024/02/alpha-priest-accused-of-shoplifting-drove-drunk-erratically-to-avoid-arrest-police-say.html). Officials with the Diocese of Metuchen confirmed that Wejernowski is stepping down as pastor of St. Mary Church in Alpha. The following is a statement from Anthony P. Kearns III, chancellor of the Diocese of Metuchen. The Diocese is aware of the incidents involving Fr. Dawid Wejnerowski, early Tuesday morning in Alpha and Pohatcong Township. We are most grateful that no one was hurt or injured, including Fr. Dawid as a result of this incident. We are also grateful to the Pohatcong Township Police Department for their quick response and treatment of Father and all involved with dignity and professionalism. It is clear, Fr. Dawid has a very serious problem with alcohol. He has accepted this fact, the first step in recovery. He will be stepping aside from his role as Pastor of St. Mary Catholic Church in Alpha to provide him the necessary time to seek inpatient treatment out of state. Fr. is extremely remorseful for his conduct. He is aware of the danger he posed to others and himself. He is resolved to seek the necessary treatment to ensure he never engages in such behavior again. Fr. is indeed sad to step away from the parish, but knows he is in need of recovery and treatment. Fr. is well loved by his parishioners and I know they too will miss him. Fr. understands there are consequences to his conduct, and he stands ready to address all the legal challenges he faces. There is a priest now temporarily assigned to the parish to give the Bishop the opportunity to assign a temporary administrator. Mass times, and all sacraments will continue on the same schedule. As indicated a priest will be available to address the needs of the parish until the arrival of the temporary administrator. Additionally, the parish staff will be available to administer to the needs of the parishioners and the parish. Bishop Checchio remains concerned for Fr. Dawid's health and well being as he does for all the parishioners and parish of St. Mary. Please keep Fr. in your prayers as he develops the skills necessary to live a life of recovery. Thank you for your interest in the well being of Fr. Dawid and the Parish. [Report a correction](mailto:trenton.dme@townsquaremedia.com?subject=Feedback or correction) ðŸ‘ˆ | ðŸ‘‰ [Contact our newsroom](https://nj1015.com/contact-nj-1015-newsroom/) LOOK: First Photos Of 'The Walmart Of The Future' Gallery Credit: Rob Carroll

author: David Rumsey
title: On a Crowded Christmas, the NBA Got Coalâ€”So Say Their Dismal Ratings
text:
The NBA knew the NFL was coming to steal its Christmas viewers. The ratings show that its strategy is working.
Not only did the NFL see viewership increases for all three of its broadcast windows in the leagueâ€™s second year of offering a Christmas Day tripleheader, but those numbers seemingly came at the expense of the NBAâ€™s traditional slate of games. Among the NFLâ€™s wins: That dayâ€™s Las Vegas Raiders-Kansas City Chiefs game on CBS scored 29.2 million viewers, making it the most-watched Christmas Day game in 34 years.
The NBA, meanwhile, saw viewership decline in each of its five games compared to the same broadcast windows in 2022. The steepest drop came from the Philadelphia 76ers-Miami Heat matchup, which drew 1.3 million viewers on ESPN and ESPN2, down 73% from last yearâ€™s 8 p.m. ET matchup between the Memphis Grizzlies and the Golden State Warriors. The 2022 game was simulcast on ABC, but this year the NFLâ€™s nightcap (Baltimore Ravens-San Francisco 49ers) got the main network slot.
Three of the NBAâ€™s other four games were down significantlyâ€”42%, 39%, and 18%â€”from comparable broadcasts on Christmas Day in 2022, according to
Sports Media Watch. The Denver Nuggetsâ€™ 120-114 victory over Golden State at 2:30 p.m. ET garnered 4.1 million viewers, per the New York Post, which would be down 5% from Dallas Mavericks-Los Angeles Lakers in that time slot in 2022.
Next year could bring some
reprieve for the NBA as Christmas falls on a Wednesday, a day the NFL typically doesnâ€™t play. But in the long term, itâ€™s clear that the NBA will continue facing competition most years, now that the NFL has decided to embrace the holiday.

author: Olympics.com
title: German Open badminton 2024: Treesa Jolly-Gayatri Gopichand in quarter-finals
text: Commonwealth Games bronze medallists Treesa Jolly and Gayatri Gopichand cruised into the quarter-finals of the German Open 2024 badminton womenâ€™s doubles event in Mulheim on Thursday. The Indian duo, 23rd in the badminton rankings , took 28 minutes to defeat their world No. 141 opponents Sona Horinkova and Katerina Zuzakova of Czechia 21-10, 21-11 in the round of 16. Treesa and Gayatri faced a tough challenge before the mid-game intervals in both games. However, a strong performance by the Indian pair after the breaks eventually made it a lop-sided affair. The Indian badminton players , who played an integral part in the Indian womenâ€™s teamâ€™s historic gold medal win at the 2024 Badminton Asia Team Championships in Busan, will take on the winner of the match between USAâ€™s Francesca Corbett-Allison Lee and the Peopleâ€™s Republic of Chinaâ€™s Li Yi Jing-Luo Xu Min. The pair of Treesa and Gayatri is the only Indian challenge alive at the German Open, a BWF Super 300 event. Earlier in the day, Aakarshi Kashyap and Sathish Kumar Karunakaran lost the womenâ€™s and menâ€™s singles second-round matches, respectively. Kashyap, world No. 43, lost 21-13, 21-14 to 22nd-ranked Mia Blichfeldt of Denmark in the round of 16. In the menâ€™s singles, Karunakaran, 50th in the rankings, suffered a 21-18, 24-22 loss against world No. 42 Nhat Nguyen of Ireland. The German Open 2024 is the sixth tournament on the 2024 badminton calendar and offers qualifying ranking points to shuttlers for the Paris 2024 Olympics. The qualification window for badminton started on May 1 last year and will end in April.
